intro: Dinophora spenneroides, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Dinophora spenneroides is often found in sandy soils and is characteristic of Mediterranean and coastal regions.
